isis.stitle: 530 and DT-466/408 Diesel Engine Service (1994) - INTRODUCTION - LUBRICATION SYSTEM - OIL FLOW

svcprocinfo.para:
Unfiltered oil is drawn from the oil pan, through the oil pick-up tube and to the front cover assembly to the oil pump. Leaving the oil pump, the unfiltered oil travels (under pressure) back through the front cover assembly, passing the high pressure oil relief valve and into the crankcase unfiltered oil galley. Any excess oil is dumped by the relief valve back into the oil pan ( Figures 10 and 11
).

note.para: The high pressure oil relief controls unfiltered oil pressure at 80 psi (552 kPa) maximum.

svcprocinfo.para: There are two oil galleries in the crankcase. The unfiltered oil travels down the unfiltered oil galley on the lower right hand side of the crankcase and the filtered oil galley runs above it. Unfiltered oil travels from the oil pump, through the front cover assembly and into the unfiltered oil galley. The oil pressure relief valve controls unfiltered oil pressure at 80 psi (552 kPa). When oil pressure exceeds 80 psi (552 kPa), the oil pressure relief valve opens and excess oil is dumped back to the oil sump. There are two exit ports in the unfiltered oil galley. One exits to the front header of the oil cooler and one exits to the rear header of the oil cooler. Depending upon the position of the oil thermostat, located in the rear header, unfiltered oil can by-pass the oil cooler core and go directly to the oil filter or can flow through the oil cooler core into the rear header.

The oil cooler thermostat opens or closes by sensing oil temperature in the unfiltered galley. Oil is directed from the unfiltered galley to the filter, were it enters from the outside of the element and exits from the center. Oil by-pass valve is located within the filter can and operates at a pressure differential of psi. Oil filter element by-pass is effected from within the filter can. Clean engine oil flows out of the filter and goes back into the oil cooler header, then out the header and into the crankcase clean oil galley. The clean oil enters the crankcase, passes the oil cooler regulator valve and is directed through various ports of the crankcase. Excess oil is dumped back into the crankcase by the regulator valve.

note.para: The oil cooler pressure regulator valve controls filtered oil pressure at 50 psi (345 kpa).

svcsubproc.title: Oil Flow
svcsubproc.para: The turbocharger receives filtered oil through an external tube connected at the rear oil cooler header. The fuel injection pump and air compressor (if equipped) also receive oil through external lines which are connected at a common fitting on the right side of the crankcase main filtered oil gallery. This fitting is supplied with oil directly from the main gallery. The front gear train is splash lubricated by oil draining from the injection pump and air compressor (if equipped).
